sentences: Bobai Balat (born 4 October 1988), better known by his stage name Bally B., is a Nigerian disc jockey, record producer, voiceover artist, and reality television personality.
He garnered popularity as one of the housemates of the Big Brother Naija 2017 reality game show; a localised franchise of the Dutch game show.

In 2015, Balat created an Afro infused electronic bootleg remix to Rihanna's hit song FourFiveSeconds, which brought industry recognition and led to a mash-up segment on Lagos city radio station; The Beat 99.9 FM.
Bally was born on (4 October 1988) in Kaduna State, the son of Paulina Yanakok and Isaiah Balat.
He began attending Purdue University in (2006), before transferring to the American University of Nigeria, after 2 years due to personal reasons.
He has officially released one single called "Ali" in (2015) featuring then label mate MoJeed and popular Abuja based rapper Sute.

sentences: He spent the majority of his adolescence in Kaduna before moving to Nigeria's capital; Abuja when he was 10 years old while also schooling in one of the most prestigious boarding schools in West Africa; Loyola Jesuit College.
He began attending Purdue University in (2006), before transferring to the American University of Nigeria, after 2 years due to personal reasons.

Today this translates into sets where he picks apart and infuses together all the pieces of this music that he loves best, transitioning seamlessly between genres, Late contemporary Afrobeats to electronic dance music, hip-hop, trap.
He has also been called upon to play alongside some of the biggest names in Afrobeats music today.
